name: Robert W. Service Multiple Choice Quiz | People | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the missing word: 'There are strange things done in the midnight sun by the men who ______ for gold'?
questions.explanation:
moil.

	'The Arctic trails have their secret tales that would make your blood run cold...'

questions.text: When was Robert W. Service born?
questions.explanation:
1874.

	To Robert Service and Sarah Emily Parker.

William.

	Walker is George W. Bush's middle name.

Dangerous Dan McGrew.

	He loved the lady known as Lou.

questions.text: Robert W. Service wrote a well-known poem about a cremation. Who was cremated?
questions.explanation:
Sam McGee & McGee.

	In the poem 'The Cremation of Sam McGee,' Service's most famous.

Yes.

	'The Trail of '98' is a novel about the Klondike Gold Rush.

questions.text: Service wrote mostly about the California gold rush.
questions.explanation:
False.

	He wrote about the Klondike Gold Rush, in the Yukon territory, Canada.

questions.text: How many brothers and sisters did Service have?

questions.explanation:
3rd.

	He migrated to Canada in 1905 at age 21.

questions.text: How old was Service's wife (Germaine Bourgoine) when she died?
